body:
### Problem

Good day to all, I'm Pedro and this is my first contribution. I would like to bring to attention some behavior that is conflicting with the documentation regarding the steps on building the current release from source.

When compiling & installing from source on Fedora Workstation 41 and trying to specify the CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE argument, `BUILD.md` instructs to build using two separate steps:  
`make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebugInfo`
followed by
`make CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$DIR`. where $DIR is the desired install path (optional).

However, following these steps as they are laid out and running :checkhealth will reveal that Neovim was built without optimizations (build type is set to Debug, the default).

Here is the head of the output when running`$ make CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$DIR install`:  ($DIR is in my case, ~/.local/nvim) 
`Re-running CMake: CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX '/home/pg-engine/.local/nvim' does not match cached value '/usr/local'.
mkdir -p ".deps"  
/usr/bin/cmake3 -S /home/pg-engine/neovim//cmake.deps -B ".deps" -G "Ninja"    
-- Found GNU Make at /usr/bin/gmake    
-- CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo  
-- Configuring done (0.2s)  
-- Generating done (0.0s)  
-- Build files have been written to: /home/pg-engine/neovim/.deps  
mkdir -p build  
touch "build/.ran-deps-cmake"  
/usr/bin/cmake3 --build ".deps"  
ninja: no work to do.  
/usr/bin/cmake3 -B build -G "Ninja" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE= -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/pg-engine/.local/nvim /home/pg-engine/neovim/  
-- Found GNU Make at /usr/bin/gmake  
-- CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/pg-engine/.local/nvim  
-- CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE not specified, default is 'Debug'`  


As you can see, CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE was set to RelWithDebInfo, and yet a few lines later, it says it's unset and defaults to Debug.

This can easily be worked around by combining `make` and `make install` in the same step, as such:
`$ make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$HOME/.local/nvim install`

It's not much, but it does seem like unexpected behavior when BUILD.md provides these as the 'official' building steps.

### Steps to reproduce

1) Clone from the stable branch.  
2) Build the specified build type using `make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo` followed by `make CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$DIR` where dir would be install dir (probably optional but that's what's on BUILD.md and that's what I did). One command followed by the other.
3) Run :checkhealth on the installed program and verify that CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE was indeed reset to Debug.

### Expected behavior

1) Clone from the stable branch.  
2) Build the specified build type using `make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo` followed by `make CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$DIR` where dir would be install dir (probably optional but that's what's on BUILD.md and that's what I did). One command followed by the other.
3) Run :checkhealth on the installed program and verify that CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE has retained the RelWithDebInfo value and that "release with debug information" is the build as specified in the previous step.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.4 

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no (build instructions direct towards ./configure --args)

### Operating system/version

Up to date Fedora Workstation 41, KDE Plasma (Wayland)

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.15.1

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

built from repo

**Edit:** minor formatting and textual clarity

comment_data.body:
I too experience this issue. Not only with `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebugInfo`, but also with `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release`, using the official Build instructions (with a custom install location).

Your fix works though. Thank you!

title: RelWithDebInfo argument set during `make` is dropped during `make install`
